posts.body:
>>62040a82-1b04-4956-ae29-f476523b901d
> How do I blacklist the inevitable shitposting threads
i guess no such option to hide unwanted threads, only hiding/muting OP and all his/her onsite content

>>9b1755bf-c90f-4506-a71a-ddc8545dac76
yes, if user if afraid hosting illegal images, he/she should not help seed whole [Millchan](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA) ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/ ) and not visit any boards that suggest CP or /b/. But i think deleting of blacklisted users/boards content should work. if not, please report it in /dev/.

Another option is to enable Tor for all connections (via zerohello (/) top button or via /Config page).
That way if you accidentaly share illegal content, no one should know your real location.

>>e5d3654e-53e9-4819-8266-46d147be84ed
If you're living in the country where police is allowed to hunt possible criminals (watch traffic, see which IPs are seeding illegal images and then obtain court order to discover data about that IP from its owner (ISP)) etc., then you should use Tor to anonymize yourself. (On zerohello, on the top, you can see the tor button) or see the /Config page.
And Tor is safe way to keep anonymous. Per my knowledge, when using Tor here on Zeronet no exist nodes (which we may not trust) are used so there are just two onion peers who can not know the real identity of each other.

>>6ed5929f-3477-4a1a-b96f-fa0e649d11d1
unsure if this modification is necessary on Linux at all times, but on Windows, it is not needed per my experience.

>>ee873d66-7c70-4949-9795-b29a46220b7d
indeed, and here is the tutorial if one wants to run a zeronet server: http://127.0.0.1:43110/16Go5kc2U9Ff4jeaY8kYiDEgpMYdgyboPY/?Topic:2_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+Install+and+run+Zeronet+on+a+Raspberry+Pi+or+any+Linux+computer
it contains some good tips

>>11b8e5fd-36a1-4324-8d75-a571b95349ef
>hit the [M] ... delete all the shit you downloaded
i tested this and it worked to mute(hide) that user post/s and also it deleted that bad image including thumbnail. I have not tested if it delete also other his posts images. Admin of this zeronet site says there can be problem with deleting: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/17wVyfuXoQmWbo8pMvzWx7iSNdA3446NdF:misc:f0efbe66-3b82-4bb7-a151-640c1c30d565#efdc2962-a583-4a33-afb4-cf551702fb6c

>>69f8be69-63bb-4ef2-98c2-e8c8990f08ee
> Images posted here are stored on my computer right?
Regarding this site, only those you see/saw are stored on your computer. You can blacklist "bad" users to prevent further content from them or you can blacklist bad boards. But you are still at risk of discovering bad image and thus starting to seed it (by default its thumbnail only). Solutions?
A) Find bad image manually via zerohello, Files tab and delete it.
B) use Tor to anonymize yourself and do not worry what you are hosting
C) use Millchan ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/ ) where muting/blacklisting user and board means deleting all the hosted content (usually only small image thumbnails, because you have not likely clicked the ba dimage to see its full size).

>>b1b7c74c-0baf-4ecd-9934-3f44390b5880
yes, zeronet data we have on the computer are portable and does not matter if you move them from windows to linux or vice versa). You just have to copy directory named "data" it is in your zeronet directory. Most important file is data/users.json as it contains username details,  followed/watched topics on various sites like zerotalk, zerome. Such file you need to backup so if your HDD crash you can regain access to your zeroid.bit ID, followed topics.

>>9b6d8c08-41f9-4538-be98-20396f5bcdf3
thx, i adjusted my post to be more clear and tested [M] button, it hidden the post and indeed deleted that post image including thumbnail from my drive ðŸ‘. I have not tested though if it also delete other posts's images across other boards and such!

>>d5d57a70-5e5e-4185-95db-4b1c2b6d6ec3
On the Millchan site ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/ ), which is the improved version of this one, you use â–¶ï¸ button to trigger menu for various actions. Editing the board is done from the bottom of the site homepage.

>>327f993f-8198-4774-b621-0cb4c63f50e8
depends if you trust your VPN provider, if yes, you are secure and anonymous. If you are paranoid about your anonymity, then go to Zerohello page (/) and on the top enable tor in zeronet for all connections. You can do it within /Config page too.

>>79e3fd9e-83c8-42af-ab5c-6d75ac5c2051
yes :D though SSD drives should be able to cope with that i guess

>>7d988f84-a893-4595-b2cf-65dca9714740
that is site size limit (its database and mandatory files. database = in this case i think all texts on this site), for global zeronet data limit it is set on ZeroHello, Files tab (on the top), value is in gigabytes.

>>10d16558-e2d3-4806-9853-e7cc8f7d64ca
no, i bet the reason why people are on this (currently) a bit outdated site is because they are linked here from clearnet.

unsure if it works on this site, but on Millchan site (1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA) if the discussion board owner blacklist user, this user posts will be hidden for all users (unless they specificaly disabled blacklist/moderating function for that board (tickbox is on the bottom)
it was added (not by me)

>>449b907b-2b88-465e-9661-d6ff0879b155
by doing that (opening this site menu under the corner button - swiping it to the left and ticking the option to Help distribute all the files, will cause your computer to download much data including crap like porn, even illegal one). So beware.
i hope you can explain in detail your claim highlighted in red bold text. i mean describing how exactly the third party could link both or multiple identities. i bet it is just a theory

That is a quite helpful zeronet based torrent index site, thanks to its search feature.

Site has low limit on amount of user submitted content though :-/
the site can be clonned and limit raised on the clone

Check article on this topic, "Intel Management Engine - worrisome proprietary technology" - http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1545125003_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Intel+Management+Engine+worrisome+proprietary+technology

>>b9412264-5538-4938-9e05-72c9b1550407
you have to disable distributing of all site files and try to [PIN] the boards you like, it may see also its files, you can check on the ZeroHello site, Files tab and in PINned boards itself. On Millchan (http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) one can also help seed all files of a certain users. Alas this outdated board does not allow this (at least yet).

>>cf4fdc8c-94e8-4bc4-902e-ada5ba3e8fef
i think On Millchan (http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) this option is under [Options] button (on the top of the page).

>>cab3cc4a-bd49-4544-b7ba-61e92bda4ed9

posts.subject: What is the good setup for anonymous & secure internet usage?
posts.body:
Here are some ideas on how to use internet anonymously:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1517258702_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/What+is+the+good+setup+for+anonymous+secure+internet+usage

>>d999436f-f942-4341-a1f2-87963aa1e7e3
> Create a wireless Zeronet router
i already tried to setup zeronet proxy on an ARM computer, it worked, though apparently zeronet used only one CPU thread which was possibly cause of the lag.
Some resources about this:

single CPU threading and RAM usage:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1565037100_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS

setup zeronet proxy on linux:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/16Go5kc2U9Ff4jeaY8kYiDEgpMYdgyboPY/?Topic:2_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+Install+and+run+Zeronet+on+a+Raspberry+Pi+or+any+Linux+computer

>>6e2460fc-49b0-44b0-a54f-39be3f6e0ef4
> want to only seed particular boards

The [PIN] link on the homepage of this zeronet site, first column of the board list will make zeronet to download all the optional files (images, videos) in the board and seed it to other people. But i think it will not automatically download newly added content. Millchan zeronet site ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/ ) allows seeding past and future content of a user. This site not yet allows it.

>>d44a488f-7285-4f5a-9b14-8ac6931e0cce

>>25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1

Anyone knows about free self-hosted VPN server/client software that does automated port forwarding from the server to the client? -> one becomes active peer when using P2P software

>>efdc2962-a583-4a33-afb4-cf551702fb6c
i tried this and in my case when i muted the user, his image including thumbnail of his post was deleted. Unsure if it works across the boards and such.

>>50ce8639-f0ea-46ea-9f6b-9f30fadb9292
@admin please kindly consider updating to millchan code, here is how: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1

>>aa649797-2d39-44de-b432-87a4243a2702
>how to set up Zeronet without EVER having it access the ... net except through TOR?

You have to edit zeronet.conf file or run zeronet with [appropriate parameters](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1535022026_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS). Here is the zeronet.conf file parameters you can use:

[global]
tor = always
trackers_proxy = tor
disable_udp

Note that you should have "[global]" only once in the file and on the top.

Description of the parameters: In "Tor: always" mode, peer connections are made thru the Tor network. Connections to all tracker are still made over a normal internet connection. (This should not be the problem as the tracker connections does not cary any sensitive information and tor connections are slower). To have even tracker connections encrypted, we use "trackers_proxy = tor".
Tor is not using UDP so that is why there is "disable _udp" option, but this option is likely not needed and when later disabling tor, it may be unwanted (limitting connections possibilities). So actualy all needed should be:
[global]
tor = always

zeronet/log/debug.log, zeronet/log/error.log can help in debugging issues

>>64a156b1-9530-4cf8-87bf-9a802153e426
>(You
i do not think it is using cache, rather the "data" directory drectly. but you can run linux or windows software that will find and delete all images containing _thumb.jpg in its name or such. But make sure you have not selected to Help distribute all the site files, else it will be redownloaded soon or later i think. You check it when you mouse drag and drop (to the left) the corner button on this page.

>>b24efb34-fa0a-4ca3-a05a-1ab8f16f3b2a
@admin please consider updating the code to add more features for everyone: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1

>>64568bca-08cc-470e-a08a-2151f354ae80
1. you can "blacklist" user for yourself using [M] button (or on Millchan site it is under â–¶ï¸ button)
2. if user is using zeroid.bit address, then you can blacklist/mute him on zeroid.bit site and it will hide all hist posts for you on all sites where he post under his zeroid.bit identity.
3. every site owner including 08chan can blacklist user identity to post content on his site. Though ofcourse user can change identity and continue harm.
It is up to site developers to make it easy for them to remove bad users content easily. Unsure if there are effective ways to silence users who constantly changing IDs.

>>25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1
it worked for me on linux and then i copied site data to windows pc and also worked. I faced small obstacle though. Here is what i did:
On Linux with a "deb" package manager. The git, g++ and npm packages was apparently already installed: "sudo apt-get install git g++ npm"
"git commit -m 'backup'" not wanted me to go thru and i had to execute following commands before it:
git config user.email "me@mail.com"
git config user.name "me"
later, there was some warning on "npm install" command, but looked not fatal and it proceed automaticaly. I finished it according to the tutorial and things are working, i see millchan functions on 08chan! Then i went to windows PC where i opened 08chan site menu and selected "This is my site", then copied all the data inside the site folder (path/to/zeronet/data/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D) from linux computer to windows computer (i excluded folder ./node_modules which was nearly 300MB), as on Linux PC i also rebuilt the site db on Windows PC (from within 08chan site menu). it works! zeronet prompts to sign & publish 4 modified files (unsure which, but wondering if this was all that needed to be replaced and if it could be done without git)
thanks, very interesting and nice tutorial

unsure if many trackers may not slow down some things, it needs testing, unsure if anyone tested and reported results.

i think that  numerous people are using following trackers file "data/1JuwWYEgApiBVNyGxhvNYyohsv4YMtxy7M/trackers_all.txt" (you visit the site (1Ju...) first and then add that trackers file address (the quoted one) into appropriate field of the page http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config/

PS: to make the site faster and more resistant to censorship, is to have most peers and as much as possible should seed all the optional files of the site (like images), some people help seed all the site files (including questionable content) like this: mouse drag & drop top right corner button on this page to the left to open menu, scroll down to Help distribute all content. Set maxiumum allowed size the file can have in order to be DLed.

>>386137d1-d198-445f-99b7-4c520ae2097e
>We all have the same default set of trackers, we don't need more unless they all go down
Sounds reasonable, though do not know if it hurts to have more. Zeronet developer (@nofish) said it is usually OK to use default ones and that zero:// ones are most efficient in terms of data transfer.

>>03ee8246-6895-488b-99a5-342284817b57
>get all the site's content without disabling Tor
you can try to setup your computer firewall the way that no one will connect you (so you will not be sending any data to other peers) and then you can go without Tor until you download majority of the content? Maybe this can be done by blocking fileserver port on router or in firewall, Fileserver port that is mentioned on the top of the ZeroHello where is port status.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1552767554_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Definition+of+the+Zeronet+fileserver+port

Not convenient? You may try to rent anonymous server (order it via tor and use cryptocurrency like Monero or mixed Bitcoin) or dedicate some minipc for it.
hi

>>9b2dcc3a-cfd4-4762-9778-f6ba48bc1e51
hi, did you tried to remove tor and install latest version manually (not via package manager)? You can also try it opposite. First make sure Tor is working itself maybe. And definately visit ZeroTalk site, login the site, download it completely and then use ZeroHello "Search in connected sites" for errors Tor is giving you. zeroTalk contains some topics that may help.

>>94a8f2d8-e6fe-4b4a-9d33-79b555c76bf2
>didn't think to check Zerotalk
i had problems with Tor myself and know there are topics about various errors Tor is producing or zeronet's tor button (on the top of the Zerohello) is showing.
two other things to check for tor error messages is
1. /var/log/messages, /var/log/syslog /var/log/tor* ...
2. zeronet/log/{error,debug}.log
and duck.com the errors + search zerotalk, zerome via zerohello

>>8eac4b84-0a98-470c-81b9-7b7c49a4d526

>>ff7aa50f-5ede-4ca0-8736-5c34f1f8c00c

>>d3e67011-b95b-4a85-a44e-469d483114d3
this version of the chan is outdated, more feature equiped and currently developed site is Millchan ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/ ) and regarding Millchan, the site owner can delete the content and co-owners too - they can serve as a moderators i bet. But i am nor sure if this site owner is able/willing to allow this or accept devlopment pull requests.

Next level of moderation is board owners themself who can hide bad users content from everyone (who did not unticked "Enable blacklist" option on the bottom of the threads of the board).
I think it was said it is not easy to have multiple moderators for the board. maybe it can be developed though? Again unsure if this site admin is willing/abble to add development changes to this site.

Next layer of moderation are users themself ([M] button, or clicking board description to mute it). User should enable Tor on the top of the ZeroHello page to keep anonymous when accidentaly seeding bad content.

>>50c9e985-54d1-43d6-888e-a012929d52d3

And finaly my last idea - site owner may edit the site code (unsure if current owner is willing/able) in order to accept posts only from certain certification authority (example zeroid.bit) and that way people can create user [blocklists](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1549533305_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/List+of+ZeroNet+blocklists+that+are+using+ContentFilter+plugin) which other peple can use to quickly get rid of bad users content).

>>d71afc02-eef1-41c6-9267-8ebc5353b25c
people should encrypt their data
>any retard with PhotoRec on your HDD can see every single image you ever seeded here
note that seeing files does not mean proving it was seeded to someone, though in some cases only having files can mean problem.. but in many countries problem starts when it is proven one was actualy uploading the file to others.
> Is SSL used when sharing content in P2P
on zeronet it is TLS protected which means no big security, you should use VPN or Tor when using zeronet and seeding questionable content

>>b316e6dc-c5e2-4a5b-a32d-27da7a6943c7
>Yes, but (like BitTorrent) it's preferred by default, not forced.
On ZN it is [TLS](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1552634420_1e2mHauMGG8GgSDvaaPrNanxvaxwpGQRV) protected and i believe we can force it using force_encryption flag , see [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1535022026_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) topic. But use VPN / Tor to ensure proper encryption of the traffic and anonymization.

>>26999332-2daf-49bf-bc57-442361656b5f
you can see others IP in the zeronet/log/debug.log (that file can contain more detailed data when you adjust your http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config/ appropriate parameter). But you can not match IP to a user with clarity, at least i have not yet came to anyone who would prove it and there was experienced users who said the same.

More information about ZeroNet?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Kt7xxVRcxHcK14Mt7YZdXfh8MzUJMkvpk/misc/The.truth.about.ZeroNet/

>>8ebeb575-393f-4333-b063-6bf1a9e72b62
if that button bothers you, i guess you would have to adjust zeronet code to make that button appear at different conditions. btw. why you are not willing to give the site more space? At least its database will need it, it is growing prety fast, already at 12MB+

You can improve it a bit by removing step 7 and instead in step 3 using following additional lines:
tor = always
trackers_proxy = tor

btw. i think (may be wrong) adding tor_controller and tor_proxy into zeronet.conf may cause trouble because on Windows and on Linux the ports are different by default. I think onwindow si think 9151,9150 and on linux i think 9051,9050 (may be wrong).

using tor browser is not necessary, zeronet will still use tor network (in Tor: always" mode as described) even if you browse ZN via Firefox

>>f859e45e-a20a-4da5-a00f-c58a4e564163
Anytime will happen bad board will be created or bad content posted offtopic into "normal" boards. You better use Tor in Zeronet (see the ZeroHello site, Tor button on the top of the site) if you are scared and want to keep anonymous. Btw. if you have seen no CP, it is ok, you are not hosting any of its images (unless you selected an option to Help seed all the files of this site - it is under the corner button on this page, when you drag and drop it to the left). Millchan zeronet site has option to enable "always spoiler" which disables download of all the images until image placeholder is clicked. 127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1

>>c799ed9c-1583-4d20-88cb-0a2190019eff
> childporn

>>59453c6c-8419-4dfc-9dff-6dbd4745c54c
very important tip, especially for the site owners! that file is in path/to/your/zeronet/data/ and contains key needed to use ones user profile, sign & publish site change + followed topics on various sites
glad it worked for you! :) it was not easy path for you though, maybe someone already made a tutorial on how to make Tor working on your Linux distribution.

>>6ab9c4db-26f4-408f-86ba-548c5aa01625
>It also has a lot more features than the old one.
yes

>>c8183bf5-2dd6-4ba8-9d59-d16f72c1ba7b
> no such column: j.cert_user_id
i would understand this as a problem with the database shema, so i would rebuild the database as suggested in first post. I am not saying it would help. I had not this problem.
Yes, setting read only permissions on site files (except data/ dir and its contents may be needed for us who are not admins of the site to prevent any possible overwriting from the main, authorized site)

>>cae8090e-9857-4d42-943a-c0bddd36622f
who knows, maybe zeronet file downloading functions are somehow tied partialy on the site be open in web browser, you can try to watch your ZeroHello/Files tab or watch some HDD activity monitoring app to see which files are using your HDD at the moment. it can also help to enable logging of everything on http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config/, restarting ZN and watching your zeronet/log/debug.log file

>>9782a156-f940-45fd-89a0-ddedc4b2a1bd
+1, when people post some media (in Zeronet terms "optional files" on this zite), they should keep zeronet running so people who specificaly request them (by clicking the image thumnail) can download these. On the ZeroHello / Files tab, one may find how many peers one's file has. If it is 3 or more it means there is chance one can shutdown PC and files will be seeded by others until one return back to help seed.

>>2b5bb954-6124-4a84-81a5-e75629f05153
You are safe and more anonymous than VPN from what i know. + you have better latency than doing VPN+Tor.

>>49620410-5073-46ec-ad11-58e8c257c8c9
maybe low amount of people requesting files and high amount of people seeding?

>>a61b29db-5529-4f5b-90af-3f7b5c278069
you should not need to click any more files seed button because all past and future file will be downloaded automatically (if these are seeded and if the file size is not bigger than the limit you set near the "Download and distribute all files" option - found under the top corner button when you gragcdrop it to the left.)
Btw, some person reported (i tend to agree) that when you click seed button, it can make the zeronet priorizite it or kind of wakeup zeronet in downloading process.

>>795ba3c5-53ed-4ac3-987d-6a36696e3e56
port forwarding is not needed in case of Tor. Check the ZeroHello, port status button (on the top), it should show you that your port is closed, but you are running tor which does not have problem of the closed/open port (right?).

>>d40a2294-d73a-4535-94c5-cca1182c3191
ðŸ‘ 22GB optional files downloaded, that is more i would expect be downloadable (because of 0 seeder).

>>76f80731-1462-48b1-8d52-9461d6d3e6ef
>image won't load
same and i am "tor: available" peer which means i am both normal and tor peer. Possibly he closed his zeronet before anyone downloaded full sized image..

>>996ce581-a15f-4496-bb9b-6e98117aeb4c
>dont enforce tor only
Disabling Tor or making it "Tor: available" may be issue for some, because if one is not using VPN to anonymize oneself, one can seed accidentaly or intentionaly bad images / content and other non-Tor peers will know ones real IP address.

If one is afraid and know he/she will seed bad content (accidentaly seeing bad content means automatically seeding it to others), he/she should use Tor for all connections ("Tor: always" - see the Tor button on the top of the ZeroHello page).

>>97303b6c-700d-47d8-9089-c3c7ddea3d8d
reasons why the number of downloaded data for the site increasing can be that you clicked some optional files (images, videos), these were not available at a time you clicked, but now some parts become available and are downloading. Another reason why it is growing is the database of the site which contains all the texts on the site. It is 13MB atm. and grows maybe 2MB/day. (today, yesterday). Size of the .db is seen in the site menu (corner button).

>>982f0ba3-c605-4d37-aea6-5f8b0ef6d2cc
there is no cache i think. only incomplete and complete optional files (images, videos..) that you can delete from within ZeroHello / Files tab. If you do not care about seeding the content, you can delete the site (from within ZeroHello, next to site are three dots) and revisit it. It will download every texts including yours.

>>990ce898-74d3-45fe-8ab0-39495ff7ad39
Yes, maybe under the Delete option to be option "Delete only optional files". ZN needs more developers https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/graphs/contributors.
Btw. deleting the site can be also done via site menu - corner button, dragged to the left by mouse)

>>8d3254b1-39b7-4e61-b4d7-760885d08a7b
Yes, i understand it that way. PIN should be one-time seeding all optional files (images, video) of the board. If later UNPIN and PIN, it should mark new files for download too.. PS: not every file is available, some files draw no attention and seeder/uploader maybe closed zeronet or is in Tor: always mode where you are in Tor: error mode thus you can not connect this seeder. Also zeronet is not non-stop trying to DL all the missing files, it would overload ones computer or network connection maybe.

>>26f406e2-67df-47f3-9fa3-1ab51862dd16
site possibly does not support user unmuting and you have to do it via ZeroHello page, next to the logo is the three dots menu where is the option to manage muted users. I can unmute boards though via Options menu of the [Millchan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) site.

>>d01b0c0c-9ffa-40d0-9899-ae02fafacab0
>you can see your real IP, even thought that Tor is in always
that is interesting, yes, tor: always mode is about being anonymous within the network, so peers can not know each other real IP (as i understand it), Tor browser prevents from clearnet servers discovering some details about the ones browser. Unsure if the clearnet website visitor analytics tools can discover full URLs including parameters of the zeronet site.. i have not tested it

>>ac44e111-fd93-4f95-979d-f6c5bafd9220
pinning should make your zeronet download all current optional files of the board i bet (images, videos..), but it seems like a bug to mark it PINned on every page reload.

>>70b9c31a-1d20-41d5-9487-3360702ffa06
on the image you have used three dots menu next to a site, you need to use three dots menu next to the zeronet logo

>>42e8c908-2ffb-4c0f-99ed-11aa127980bc
excelent peer count. i was always wondering how zeronet is calculating Local peer count. Yours is high.

PS: My connected peer count is 13. Total 2724. I have filesharing port closed (due to using VPN without port forwarding), i bet it may be one of the reasons.

>>592bcc5f-2949-4edb-b43d-ef2b8ff790ce
>white pictures
no, it is a bug that happen when user upload image using Tor browser. This bug was fixed on Millchan (http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) already. 

When you mute a user, his past and future content is hidden from you. By opt-in blacklist, maybe is meant this: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1549533305_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/List+of+ZeroNet+blocklists+that+are+using+ContentFilter+plugin (you can clone and run such a blacklist too, then share it with others, but it is not convenient to update it manually editting the file)

when using this (saving data only to RAM) and always generating new identity, one loose ability to modify own content of previous identities. (if not backed up zeronet/data/users.json where the identities are located).
also after rebooting, and visiting 08chan zite, you have to relly on other people having images as you have none (none from previous sesion).

>>415e91fe-28f4-4e5f-aafc-f3908e114a4d
you will receive random ID, and you are anonymous. i see no need for me to change ID on this 08chan. But i am also wondering how to generate multiple chan IDs and switch between them.

>>92332e1b-3946-4784-8653-7cbba63a07ed
Text only chan can be made. It is only up to site owner. Many people would want images to stay. Anyone can clone this site and adjust ([some tips](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1)) so it does not show images, even me can do it i think. Question is if the lag cause are images.

>>ab538db1-6de0-4348-a0a7-a176a724b826
owner is owner, he have full rights to the site contents. he can modify it, delete it, delete all the files and his changes will be propagated to all the peers. If some peer make a backup, it can be useful to him to create new site with same content and functions.

>>5859e7dd-93a6-423b-9a2a-5eb2f4fe9912
>How do I encrypt HDD?
You can use VeraCrypt or TrueCrypt for example. Works on both Linux and Windows. Linux has built in encryption option during installation.

>>decc5da9-0ecf-4373-987c-a36e27bb2030
i think when you reply someone, you can edit own username. Regarding other people usernames, you have to see them i guess.
Regarding hardware based id, there was similar idea: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1310
but we need someone to make it happen along with the zeronet's maintainer agreement.

posts.subject: 08chan posting problems?
posts.body:
I had a few problems, but no longer. problems and solutions:

PROBLEM:
"Content signing failed - Private key invalid! Valid signers: ..."

SOLUTION:
A) maybe you have just switched the onsite identy using the site menu (corner button moved to the left), but you have not reloaded/refreshed the page yet.
B) try to post under different identity (zeroid.bit or 08chan). identity may be changed when creating new thread or via site menu (corner button moved to the left). Reload page after ID change.

>>ebf5a6ff-9b2f-42ef-a8bb-3245442fb8e5
+1 anon

>>9a7272ed-5af0-44b1-b622-8f4f85fc8267
>  I slid the button on the top right and I'm seeding files up to 10MB. .. Should I disable that and seed per board only?
yes, you should,. that way you will prevent seeding more questionable images/videos..
Maybe you can check ZeroHello site, and then Files section and delete 08chan optional files you already downloaded. Or quit zeronet and delete all the directories of other users. (zeronet/data/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/data/users/ - you have to discover what is your user directory - it match your identity address which you can see in this site menu (corner button moved to the left) - you do not want to delete your directory if you have uploaded some files, because if no one download these yet, these may be lost in such a case).

> How would I update to millchan?
Update instructions thread here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1

>>f557808a-4473-410b-b727-9461097af182
>I have Millchan already
difference between 08chan and MC is (among other) in the appearance of the list of the boards on the homepage. the millchan (update) does not feature [Pin] links before boards on homepage. The same feature is hidden under the board description on homepage.
you mean updated site code or also some optional files like images people are uploading

>>c1439ddf-f475-41d5-b913-9ef698d7d73a
You seem to be clever to understand the things. Can you help nofish to fix this?
His TODO and In progress list:
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/projects/1
Notice the "Move database connection to separate thread" - "Why?

To avoid blocking the application on heavy/large amount of queries." - i think this particular "fix" was quoted as possible solution to zeronet being stuck at various cases. Also i am not sure if ZN utilize all available CPU threads. PS: this thread is overloading my CPU, it is too large without paging (on my end).

>>feefb7ff-dc07-4258-8244-b8084eed68bd
It is a nice overview. Worth publishing on Zerotalk or such..

>>0286960d-c13f-4088-9c8a-6e2adce0eb27
why do you think so?
If you post something, other users (who spend time discovering your public key and then find same named user folder in their zeronet folder can see your other posts that you have made under same identity on this site. But it does not breaks ones anonymity. There was not proved any way to match user id to actual IP. If you use Tor, you are anonymous.

>>be42ed5f-2ce6-466a-8857-864f15cf44de
> see this
yes

>>79caca4d-6284-46f2-b7c4-0d81fc925a4e

i am using Firefox extension called "Chameleon" it randomises UA and many more things: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1544691845_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Browser+fingerprint+should+i+be+concerned+about+it#comment_2_1Du5Mm5G9v6ouagRsd7vkht1oNNNA2tjen

>>5faf6cb4-2648-40d8-ad75-1bc44344550c
>wouldn't that allow others to uniquely identify you by checking which files you're "missing"

i think i understand better now. i think answer is that users can not identify me, because they does not know which all the files i downloaded or which i am missing.

> what about >>b73b318b416a ?
i do not know i have updated code to millchan ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1 ), so i can not pair this kind of string to a post (i believe) i can pair >>XY kind of links though.

>>6b56fec8-eab8-4013-9894-922f37de8b27
the architecture looks good. trees and plants are important part of it
My understanding is that this kind of blacklist is maintained by the board owner. If you do not want him to moderate this board, untick the blacklist on the bottom of this page.

>>8a91930d-37d1-43ce-9a77-a7dfeba8c53a
> wasn't deleted for some reason

Some details about muting feature in regards to a content deletion problems is in the "Announcements and ongoing issues" thread leading post.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:b:50ce8639-f0ea-46ea-9f6b-9f30fadb9292

Use Tor for all connections to anonymize your uploads. (Tor button on the top of the ZeroHello site)

>>d657e2d7-02b2-4e13-b15b-3d78c57a8748
>they remain on your PC
i bet all the site text is mandatory and is in the site database. BO blacklisting should only hide the texts from sight..

>>
testing mp3 upload..
PS: it happened to me that some mp3s play, some does not play and says unsupported MIME. But now i can not reproduce and all seems playing. :-P

>>6bcbe000-395d-40ba-b289-872286f43fd8
it should be done in the data/users/content.json if i am not wrong.

>>88982fae-7ba0-4652-84bb-8a1bc5c95fa2
> Seed all files is on btw
Yes, that is the cause as it override any muting functions. Simply you have to treat that "Help distribute all" option the way that it has #1 priority regarding seeding. Simply if you enable it, you download everything (as name says). Muting then works the way that it hide the content from your sight + delete the files, which then gets again downloaded (as a cause of "Help distribute all" function) i bet. Maybe try to visit Millchan zite and ask on /dev board if this is something that is possible to be prevented or if the message that warns one about data removal upon Muting should appear only in case one do NOT have "Help distribue all files" option enabled.

>>f747ec6c-f2e0-4dd2-954f-f3da24bdeda2
i had also read that the mute function may have problems deleting data under some circumstances, that may also be the cause of you seeding something from blacklisted boards/users.
Here are details in the first post of [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:b:50ce8639-f0ea-46ea-9f6b-9f30fadb9292) topic. Quoting: "If you mute a user who has a very large number of files in your cache, and/or you have files from that user open in other tabs, the system may not offer you the prompt "this will delete all of this users files" and instead only ask if you want to mute them. If you choose yes they will be muted but the files will NOT be deleted. If this happens, make a note of the first 5 characters of their ID hash from the Mute message and go into your Zeronet folder, the 1DdPH... folder, /data/users and ctrl+f for those 5 characters. Shift-rightclick their folder and hit delete and scrub the files manually."

>>c7592aa0-25e9-4e0d-bb61-f9bd8ba9101f
>seeding all files ... I thought you only seeded the ones you visited.
i think that all means "ALL" - all files of the site. if you want to seed only particular boards images/videos, there is an option for that on the site index(home page).
>>4ecaa9ca-33d7-4c76-aa7e-b9d55d3d9d06
i do not believe muting can prevent "Download and help distribute all files" function to download files of the muted users/in blacklisted boards.

>>8eb718bc-6fc2-453d-86f0-b6b7ca078ffa
>If it would download it even with mute then I should see a lot of CP
I do not think this is a proof that the "Download and help distribute all files" option ignores files belonging to a boards that are in your 08chan blacklist. Why? because this is a custom blacklist of this site and i bet it is not in any universal zeronet supported fashion which would the mentioned function was programmed to ignore such a blacklist files. Very unlikely in my opinion. 

Another possibility why zeronet not re-downloaded the CP you have deleted is that it maybe does not constantly reattempt to download every file (it may be computer resources intensive?) or it will not attempt to download it again at all (maybe until "Check files" option is executed within ZeroHello site?) or it will attempt with some delay. It is the question how ZN is developed, but again i think it is unlikely the "Download and help distribute all files" option is caring about local site board blacklist. Maybe it can care about user blacklist as i think it is managed internaly by zeronet (zeronet/data/filters.json), ZeroHello, three dots menu, Manage muted users.. but i also doubt the function is made to care, i think the fucntion means that it will instruct zeronet to download all optional files (images etc.) and if you delete completely downloaded image, ZN will not possibly re-attempt DL. -> do not enable that all files downloading option if you do not want to seed everything on this site. PS: Tor can help anonymize your uploads.

hi, anyone else has problem following thread?
You go to some never seen thread that you do not follow, for example [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:b:dd9949af-25a9-45d2-934f-59ce4de4af91) and above the first post you click the arrow icon and select "Follow thread", but it does nothing. Though on [Millchan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA), it works..

probably this will not help, only waste your time, so do it only if you are ok with that:
You can check "Check files" option on ZeroHello site, next to 08chan site entry is three dots menu. Also you can try to delete bad files manually from zeronet/data/sites.json (it may be under entry "1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D") - but maybe rather backup the file and quit ZN before modifications. It will not help possibly.
Also assuming you hav enot changed files permissions under 08chan zeronet directory. Rebuild site database (from within this site menu: corner button moved to the left).
Restart zeronet?

>>e3769483-0671-43f9-990c-5eb08a046e18
>users.json file in the Zeronet folder, delete
it is most important file that contains identities, keys to one's sites, followed zerotalk, zeroblog, zerome topics - when deleted you will loose all these.

To change zeroid, you can also enable multiuser plugin - http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1564850670_17FTEKfnFVM6XGctStcwZLue3N8BxHbrmz
That way you should be able to switch zeroids via top button on ZeroHello site.

you should mention better tutorial on how to use the blocklist, because user can end up with invalid file because of excessive comma (,).

it should say: paste following code to the third line in your ZeroNet/data/filters.json. Right after line:
  "includes": {
In case your filters.json file does not include any blocked users yet, you have to remove the last character of the pasted text (the comma).
[releases](https://gitgud.io/08chan/post-checker/-/releases) page is empty, i am wondering how a M$ Windows user can use it.

>>ef6ab13c-23ce-4391-916d-0ba5aa699c60
it is the same like on zerotalk, zerome, zeroblogs: [text] (link)
(remove space between parenthesis)
>>d6b698cd-94ec-4e43-93b8-3f9b979af7ec
yes, on this site... and unless you have created 08chan ID before there was a SPAM issue, in such case you should be able to continue using that old ID. Btw. on [Millchan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) site, the zeroid is optional. On [0chan](/1FiSxj2yDPeGuuf6iBwRAXvEMQJATAZNt6) also

>>fc459b0c-f2cc-4b6e-a564-88706b4e24f0
i think that all people who visited this site are seeding complete database of the site (all texts), when you open the site menu (corner button moved to the left) and scroll down, you can see the DB size is more than 20K kilobytes (20MB+). If the site reach the SIZE LIMIT (also defined in the mentioned menu), it will not properly update i bet and on zerohello site you will be prompted to increase it.
Another thing are optional files (images etc.), that works i think like you described: ZeroHello site, click "Files" in top left corner and then on the top right you can set the total limit of all zeronet optional files. If the limit is reached i think zeronet should delete optional files that has most seeders.

>>af33cbe9-684a-48b8-8168-314f0bb748e8
> Coreboot and Libreboot might not be enough
Why? do you have any link?

> If an update is available
i bet you mean zeronet update, not site update. If so, i prefer updates like now for simplicity. I do not understand how manual updates would make people use other versions of the zeronet. I wish i understand your description, but i do not.

>>94e91ec1-58bc-406a-a6fe-dba7c1320aa9
what do you mean by "reclaiming the clearnet"?

>>2da5ca24-956c-4106-89a3-65a5292af26c
no one prevents any developer to create new application similar to zeronet so it form a P2P site with custom features zeronet does not have.

> All the users of the site would access and modify the same data
yes, it is same on zeronet. there is only one authorized version of the data

>>4dedafae-793a-42dc-a493-fb2287fb2b1a
> This ID can be acquired by using ZeroNet over the clearnet just long enough to visit
> http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/
i think that more anonymity "paranoid" attitude would be to open it [inside Tor browser](/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-with-the-tor-browser) in order to anonymize any clearnet connections right?

>>c2e2be1e-81b5-4014-a74c-18dbefa45e21
>improve the chances of someone help seeding all of this
or decrease chances, as one may be lazy to click the seed button too many times bro

Good idea. Unfortunately the admin have to update the blocklist not convenienty - by manually editting data/*.json file. Even multiple users can be allowed to manage one blacklist (by sharing sites private key).
For users, it is simple. They just visit the site and enable blocklist. That will hide all posts of the users on the blocklist from whole zeronet.

>>10d00a4b-9235-4281-8822-99b193a2edf5
:D

>>ee341502-a8cf-4f6a-be87-802636776982
> There's nothing preventing you from inadvertently downloading CP thumbnails and seeding them
not entirely. you can enable "always spoiler" in the [options] menu on the top of this page. It will prevent loading thumbnails until clicked. Millchan zite also allows deleting thumbnails if these are unwanted. People afraid from CP use Tor (can be enable on the top of the ZeroHello site) to anonymize their uploads and does not enable seeding of all the site content, boards or users (some spammer can add bad content to a "good" board) - but since you have Tor: always, you are anonymous even if seeding bad content.

>>581991d6-05c5-4a21-8704-2ff08b5327ff
i do not think auth_address or self_signed cert can influence anonymity. It is the Tor that does anonymization. And even without Tor, no one proved to match particular ID/certificate/auth_address to a IP. You do not know if person is an initial poster of a regular peer.

>>39b2f20d-b0ab-43e8-baa0-983e0d873f74
>IP shows up a disproportionally large number of times in the "bearer of unseen posts made by this ID"
> which IPs he was connected to when he received each new post coming from a certain ID
there are numerous peers, how you can know from the zeronet connections which one is the post sender. Maybe if some hacker/group setup too many zeronet computers (peers) and monitor connections + which posts apearing when. Unsure if these may come with some acceptable probability.

> controlling a large number of the nodes
Tor relays usually proccess alot of traffic, how do you differentiate zeronet peer connections from non-zeronet and match it to an IP (peers does not interconnect dirrectly in Tor mode and also the traffic is encrypted if i understand correct) while that discovered (if possible) IP can be regular peer not an initial poster. This is several layers to break and they can count only with probability in my opinion.
Even if they can come with some probability (to match IP to a post author), i doubt they will pursue you and get a court order based on such possibility that some IP connected certain honeypot at similar time when some post was published on certain darknet - seems a unrealistic - i was told by the police investigator that they are getting court order to go into your home and take computer only in serious cases like murder, terrorism. In my country police is not allowed to do this - to proactively research/hunt for possible law violators. + even if they get to your home/office, there can be multiple computers and these can also be encrypted. And also how they can prove who was sitting behind the computer at a time of a violation. Another [layer of protection is good VPN](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1548340010_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+setup+private+OpenVPN+on+a+Linux+server+and+Windows+Android+client) i assume.

>>f01a2a8d-d1f6-40b6-a054-da2297547e4d
thanks for the explanations, interesting. Maybe ZeroNet or Tor can be somehow improved in order to have stronger privacy and anonymity. But it needs developers which i am not. https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/
Btw. how do you use ZN to be reasonably anonymous and secure?

>>5c4015c8-46ec-47de-a462-33bfa70929dd
Do you have any insight into why one should use [Tor for the trackers connections](/Config)? ZN docs says "When you want to open a new site it asks for visitor's IP addresses from BitTorrent trackers.", so it does not seem like asking for the peers is something that can reveal something about me? PS: maybe zeronet trackers (those made by Bootstrapper plugin - zero://) can be made to record these requests, but still how this can be problem for my privacy and anonymity?

>>5ff36080-e10a-431a-bb04-30eea1b565e6
Wondering if in Tor browser i also need to enable the Tor for tracker connections. Or if these are anonymoused. Note that some trackers are udp:// and i read Tor is using TCP only.

>>5d6c65fa-68fe-4886-a2b1-74dae701a1ca
What about trying to restart [Firefox with extensions (plugins) disabled](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-extensions-themes-to-fix-problems#w_start-firefox-in-safe-mode) and working like that a few hours if restart will continue to happen. If no restart, the cause is probably some extension, maybe try disabling some unnecessary extensions. If browser continue restart, maybe [try to refresh it](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/refresh-firefox-reset-add-ons-and-settings) (i think it backup your profile during the task).

>>22efc631-3645-4cbc-b335-bba20b02789d
isn't better /programming than /pr to better recognize the board on Recent posts (site homepage). I think it is possible to edit board details also on the bottom of the homepage.

posts.subject: ZFS filesystem
posts.body:
>>1505cce6-e69f-411b-9105-d7bc35229649
>Does someone know what the peer count actually means under optional files?

i think it means how many peers have the file (unsure if necessarily complete in case of the bigfiles)

>> ramdisk for highly downloaded pdf's/files
current zeronet traffic is low so it is not necessary (in my opinion). Btw. i read interesting info. about ZFS filesystem, but possibly it is too complicate Linux thingy and more simple is to create normal RAM disk.

ZFS:
> "In a ZFS raid, sequential performance scale with number of data disks so a few disks can give a sequential performance good for a 10G network. For a random read/write workload where SSDs are much faster, ZFS use its superiour rambased read/write caches (blockbased not filebased with a read most/ read last strategy on reads). It is quite usual to have a read hit rate from cache over 80%. This is why you see ZFS storage systems with > 100 GB RAM.
>Additionally you can extend the rambased readcache Arc with an SSD or NVMe readcache L2Arc (max 10 x RAM) where you can additionally enable read ahead what can improve some sequiental workloads."
and when you click [Options] button on the top of this page, scroll down, do you see :pol among other?
it is bad idea to share files without packing them into .zip archives? So one can select only e-books of interest?

>>ebb0edf4-db62-4902-8ac4-c746477decce
> lthough it get "published" to other peers and even get listed in the sites, it isn't saved on the network.
this does not make sense to me. If it is published to peers, it means it is published to network - peers=network ... Why do you think it is not on the network?

> Nullpaste wasn't have with the text size
Try its [bigger sized clone](http://127.0.0.1:43110/131DjP88RMUo5v5twZDkD39wECdWZxzLtm/)
[185 VPN services compared by anonymity, logging policy](https://thatoneprivacysite.net/#detailed-vpn-comparison)
In next days/weeks am looking to install LXC (Linux virtualization) on Raspberry Pi 4B in order to run multiple ZeroNet instances making Zeronet more responsive... what do you think?

i assume that one must have static public IPv4 in order to run Tor relay right?
A) rented from ISP
C) possibly better: rent a virtual or dedicated server from a datacenter

PS: IPfire has addons that can do many things like NFS, Samba, Transmission, QEMU virtualization
https://wiki.ipfire.org/addons

[Persecuted and Forgotten? A Report on Christians oppressed for their Faith 2017-19](https://acn-marketing-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/reports/acn-persecuted-and-forgotten-2019.pdf) by John Pontifex and John Newton. Additional research and material by Citra Abbott and Murcadha O Flaherty. Special thanks to Caroline Hull, Christopher Jotischky-Hull and especially Tony Smith.Published by    12-14 Benhill Avenue, Sutton, Surrey SM1 4DA, UK  |  Tel: 020 8642 8668  |  Email: acn@acnuk.

posts.body: put that videos on P2P networks thanks to P2P clients like Shareazza, ApexDC++

"iSEC found no evidence of backdoors or otherwise intentionally malicious code in the assessed area"
https://opencryptoaudit.org/reports/iSec_Final_Open_Crypto_Audit_Project_TrueCrypt_Security_Assessment.pdf

"CS identified four(4) issues, and none led to a complete bypass of confidentiality in common usage scenarios. The standard workflow of creating a volume and making use of it was reviewed, and no significant flaws were found that would impact it."
https://opencryptoaudit.org/reports/TrueCrypt_Phase_II_NCC_OCAP_final.pdf
